DataElement.preferredDefinition: The histologic changes in a biospecimen that are associated with pre-malignant conditions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Microscopic Findings Domain Biospecimen Premalignant Change
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Descriptive of a condition that may or is likely to become cancerous._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Descriptive of a condition that may or is likely to become cancerous.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Descriptive of a condition that may or is likely to become cancerous.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Severe dysplasia with angiogenic squamous dysplasia changes
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Severe Dysplasia with Angiogenic Squamous Dysplasia changes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Severe Dysplasia with Angiogenic Squamous Dysplasia changes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of severe cellular atypia associated with severe architectural changes in a tissue sample.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of clusters of capillaries projecting into a dysplastic bronchial epithelium. It is considered a pre-invasive lesion.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of severe cellular atypia associated with severe architectural changes in a tissue sample.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A morphologic finding indicating the presence of dysplasia in the bronchial squamous epithelium. It is precursor of lung squamous cell carcinoma.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 8/12/22 added alt VM for Alliance cjl;

PermissibleValues.value: Basal cell hyperplasia with angiogenic squamous dysplasia changes
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Basal Cell Hyperplasia with Angiogenic Squamous Dysplasia changes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Basal Cell Hyperplasia with Angiogenic Squamous Dysplasia changes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pathologic hyperplastic process characterized by the proliferation of the cells of the epithelial layer that resemble the basal cells of the lower part of the epidermis.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of clusters of capillaries projecting into a dysplastic bronchial epithelium. It is considered a pre-invasive lesion.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic hyperplastic process characterized by the proliferation of the cells of the epithelial layer that resemble the basal cells of the lower part of the epidermis.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A morphologic finding indicating the presence of dysplasia in the bronchial squamous epithelium. It is precursor of lung squamous cell carcinoma.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic finding indicating the transformation of glandular or transitional epithelial cells to, usually, mature squamous epithelial cells.  Representative examples include squamous metaplasia of bronchial epithelium, cervix, urinary bladder, and prostate gland.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the transformation of glandular or transitional epithelial cells to, usually, mature squamous epithelial cells.  Representative examples include squamous metaplasia of bronchial epithelium, cervix, urinary bladder, and prostate gland.

PermissibleValues.value: Squamous metaplasia with angiogenic squamous dysplasia changes
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Squamous Metaplasia with Angiogenic Squamous Dysplasia changes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Squamous Metaplasia with Angiogenic Squamous Dysplasia changes

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the transformation of glandular or transitional epithelial cells to, usually, mature squamous epithelial cells.  Representative examples include squamous metaplasia of bronchial epithelium, cervix, urinary bladder, and prostate gland.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm which is confined to the epithelial layer without evidence of further tissue invasion.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm which is confined to the epithelial layer without evidence of further tissue invasion.
